chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13
Cause Child <13 to View/Listen Sex. Act.

result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald L Kupsky was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Ronald L Kupsky was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ronald L Kupsky is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Ronald L Kupsky was found guilty of 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).
  • Ronald L Kupsky was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Ronald L Kupsky was found guilty of Child Sexual Exploitation - Videos, Records, etc. [Modifiers: Penalty - Sexual Exploitation of a Child], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.05(1)(b).
  • Ronald L Kupsky was found guilty of Possession of Child Pornography [Modifiers: Penalty - Possession of Child Pornography], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Pay costs of the action. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Comply with a psycho-sexual evaluation and recommendations, as determined by DOC. Comply with mental health evaluations, recommendations, and counseling.

No contact with minors. No contact with current or prior victims, D.M.F., S.E.F., or their immediate family, residence, place of employment, or school. No possession/use of cell phone with a functional camera, internet or imaging capability. No possession/use of a camera or image recording device, without DOC permission. No possession/use of a computer without DOC approval. No internet access without DOC approval and monitoring software.
Comply with Sex Offender Registry. Comply with Sex Offender Treatment Program, as determined by DOC.

Defendant Ronald L Kupsky in court with attorney Raj Kumar Singh. Defendant Ronald L Kupsky in custody. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Other parties in courtroom are identified. Court reviews documentation provided by Atty Singh, advises of review of file, including PSI, Amended PSI, psychological report. Judge introduces herself, questions Defendant, who has no questions. Defense/State are prepared to proceed, have received and reviewed all reports. Court questions Defense, who argues against consideration of psychological report for sentencing. State presents argument. Court thinks PSI is very comprehensive, will consider psychological report as it pertains to sentencing factors. Court questions victim and mother who do not intend to make statements today. Court reviews Defendant's right to allocution. Discussion regarding various reports. State/Defense present sentencing arguments. Defendant makes statement. Court makes statement, imposes sentence.

Count 1 - Guilty; Count 2 - Not Guilty; Count 3 - Guilty; Count 4 - Guilty, yes to question; Count 5 - Guilty, yes to question

Defendant Ronald L Kupsky in court with attorney George Steve Pappas. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Testimony resumes. State rests. Defense moves for dismissal. Testimony taken. Defense rests. State presents argument on Defense's motion. Court denies motion. State/Defense make closing arguments. State makes rebuttal argument. Court gives jury instructions. Alternate juror excused. Oath of Bailiff given. Jury excused to deliberate. Clerk/Bailiff sworn/testify. State presents argument. Defense moves for mistrial. Jury returns for questioning by Court. Court denies motion. Jury returns with verdicts. Court polls jury. Jury excused. State moves for judgments on verdicts. Court orders judgment on Counts 1, 3, 4, 5, orders PSI. State requests that bond be revoked. Court revokes bond. Defense moves for judgment notwithstanding the verdicts. Court denies motion.

Defendant Ronald L Kupsky in court with attorney George Steve Pappas. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity, reviews receipt of variety of filings from Counsel, questions if everyone is in agreement on how to proceed. State makes statement, does not think Court has to hold a hearing. Court responds. Defense responds. State advises that there is volume, but not different episodes or allegations. Defendant Ronald L Kupsky in court with attorney George Steve Pappas. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews motions, request from Defense to review additional materials. Defense makes statement. Court did not get decision finished last week, has reviewed Ringer case, does not think Defense will be able to get it in, is unsure of State's position regarding in camera review of additional materials. Defense agrees that standard is quite high, is not sure he would make request to introduce them at trial, doesn't know what's in recording, would like Court to review documents in their entirety. State doesn't even know if materials exist, presents argument. State/Defense present arguments about what is being requested. Court is not convinced that in camera review shouldn't be done, will let Counsel know by letter Weds. or Thurs. whether materials are to be produced for in camera review or not.
